Context:
Program Name: Continuing Education ESL Pathway to George Brown College Certificates and Diplomas
Code: R903
Credential: George Brown College Certificate
Method of Study: Part-time
Duration: Must complete the program within three consecutive academic years.
Starting Months: January, May, September
Location: St. James Campus
Program Availability:
- Fall 2024: Not Available for domestic and international students
- Winter 2025: Opening Soon for domestic students (not study permit eligible), not available for international students
- Spring 2025: Opening Soon for domestic students (not study permit eligible), not available for international students
Program Description: A part-time program helping students meet the minimum English Language admissions requirement for any of George Brown's full-time Ontario College Certificate, Diploma or Postgraduate Certificate programs. Not applicable to programs with a co-op component.
Completion of this program eliminates the need to write TOEFL, IELTS, or George Brown's English Admissions Assessment.
George Brown's Admissions Department recognizes these pathway courses as the English Language requirement for any George Brown full-time (without co-op) programs.

Context:
The Continuing Education ESL Pathway program at George Brown College is designed for those looking to meet the English Language requirement for any full-time (without co-op) Ontario College Certificate, Diploma, or Postgraduate Certificate programs. This pathway applies only to studies within George Brown and does not guarantee entry into the chosen program. The following mandatory ESL courses must be completed to meet the minimum English language admission requirement:

1. ESL 9068 - ESL IIIB ADVANCED ($382.00)
2. ESL 9073 - Advanced Grammar and Composition Skills ($316.00)
3. ESL 9069 - Advanced Essay Writing ($316.00)
4. ESL 9078 - Academic Preparation for College/University Studies or IELTS Exam Preparation ($284.00)

Please note that completion of these Con Ed ESL courses does not guarantee entrance into the GBC program, as graduates will be considered and ranked among other applicants to their chosen program. The information regarding courses is subject to change without notice.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Continuing Education ESL Pathway to George Brown College Certificates and Diplomas Program R903 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context:
Program: BC program in George Brown College

Admission Requirements:
- The Continuing Education ESL Pathway to George Brown College Certificates and Diplomas is composed of four mandatory courses.
- Entry to each course requires the completion of a specific prerequisite course or the equivalent English placement test result.
- Before registering in the course, please refer to the Courses section above and verify the language requirements for your respective course.

Fees:
- Domestic Tuition: Please see the Courses tab for fee details.
- International Tuition: Please see the Courses tab for fee details.

Application:
- Domestic and International Students: To apply for the program, please visit the Courses section and register directly in your respective course(s) by following the instructions provided.
- International Students of R903 program: You DO NOT need to apply through the George Brown College Online Application System.

Contact Information:
- Contact Centre: 416-415-2000 (TTY 1-877-515-5559) or long distance at 1-800-265-2002.
- School of ESL office: 416-415-5000, ext. 4826 or email conedesl@georgebrown.ca.

Financial Assistance: This program is not eligible for OSAP funding.

Disclaimer: The information contained in this website is subject to change without notice. It should not be viewed as a representation, offer or warranty. Students are responsible for verifying George Brown College fee requirements.

Note: Courses in this program are for continuing education purposes only. To earn credits toward a full-time George Brown program, we offer the English for Academic Purposes program (R105 for domestic students and R115 for international students).

Virtual Campus Tour: Visit Our Campus to see our state-of-the-art facilities in downtown Toronto.
